articles.description: Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy says sacking manager Ange Postecoglou after he led the club to victory in the Europa League was "emotionally" difficult.
articles.title: Daniel Levy: Tottenham chairman says sacking Ange Postecoglou was 'emotionally' difficult

articles.description: Alessia Russo and some of her England team-mates will not use social media during Euro 2025 because online abuse can be "really damaging."
articles.title: Alessia Russo: 'Social media could be really damaging during Euros'

articles.description: The man who was given a restraining order for stalking Emma Raducanu has been blocked from applying for Wimbledon tickets.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu: Stalker blocked from applying for Wimbledon tickets

articles.description: Former Premier League referee David Coote is charged by the Football Association over comments made about ex-Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp.
articles.title: David Coote: Ex-Premier League referee charged by FA over Jurgen Klopp comments

articles.description: Robert Kubica says some of the doubts upon his F1 return hurt him following serious injury, but his Le Mans win in a Ferrari proves many wrong.
articles.title: Robert Kubica: Le Mans winnner says criticism of his return to F1 hurt

articles.description: England fightback from 5-1 down to draw 5-5 with Germany in an extraordinary game at the European Under-19 Championship.
articles.title: England U19s 5-5 Germany U19s: Young Lions stun after astonishing comeback

articles.description: Al-Hilal's chief executive Esteve Calzada says a possible loan move for Cristiano Ronaldo for the Club World Cup would have been "completely counter-intuitive".
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Al-Hilal loan move would have been 'completely counter-intuitive'

articles.description: Tennis players call for the introduction of identity verification on social media after British number two Katie Boulter shared her experiences of online abuse.
articles.title: Katie Boulter abuse: Tennis players call for social media ID after online abuse

articles.description: The Premier League fixtures for the 2025-26 season are released on Wednesday. Here's all you need to know.
articles.title: Premier League fixtures: 2025-26 schedule to be released on Wednesday, 18 June at 9am

articles.description: Mercedes team principal Toto Wolff says Red Bull's protest against George Russell at the Canadian Grand Prix was "petty" and "embarrassing".
articles.title: Toto Wolff: Red Bull's protest 'petty' and 'embarrassing' against Mercedes' George Russell
